content.question:
Ruth rode her bicycle on a straight trail. She recorded her velocity v(t), in miles per hour, for selected values of t over the interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 2.4 hours, as shown in the table above. For 0 < t ≤ 2.4, v(t) > 0.

(a) Use the data in the table to approximate Ruth's acceleration at time t = 1.4 hours. Show the computations that lead to your answer. Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text:
Ruth rode her bicycle on a straight trail. She recorded her velocity v(t), in miles per hour, for selected values of t over the interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 2.4 hours, as shown in the table above. For 0 < t ≤ 2.4, v(t) > 0.

(a) Use the data in the table to approximate Ruth's acceleration at time t = 1.4 hours. Show the computations that lead to your answer. Indicate units of measure.

(b) Using correct units, interpret the meaning of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>2.4</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43DD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of the problem. Approximate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>2.4</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@43DD@</annotation> </semantics> </math> using a midpoint Riemann sum with three subintervals of equal length and values from the table.

(c) For 0 ≤ t ≤ 2.4 hours, Ruth's velocity can be modeled by the function <math> <semantics> <mi>g</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGNbaaaa@39E8@</annotation> </semantics> </math> given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.7</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B56@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. According to the model, what was Ruth's average velocity during the time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 2.4?

(d) According to the model, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>24</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>0.7</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B56@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, is Ruth's speed increasing or decreasing at time t = 1.3? Give a reason for your answer.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
